intro: Callitriche anisoptera, commonly known as the narrowleaf water starwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Callitrichaceae. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. The plant has slender, floating or submersed stems with opposite, linear leaves that are often slightly curled. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in nutrient-rich waters. Callitriche anisoptera plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water clarity through its dense growth.
